revisionDesc.change: corrected choice encoding of 'st louis' and 'georgy'
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Annotate date and add notes on Lowell and cleaning of George's house.
Clean encoding (editor, date, remove "_large") and add standard annotations on unannotated files (Jeff W, Martha [Mattie], George W, Lou Haslam)

body.p: i will write a few lines once more before you come i got your letter on saturday Saturday i havent haven't heard from st louis St. Louis since i wrote to you so i suppose they are about the same or perhaps better than when i last heard) neither have i heard from georgeyGeorgey he left some money for me to put in the bank as the bank was shut when he came from new york New York after i put it in he wanted me to send him a line of the amount invested as the bank book was at the bank to have the interest cast up so i got the man to put it on a paper the whole amount and i sent it to him

there aint ain't much new walterWalter dear with me i am limping around as usual
the paper man is fixing the hall has been a week at it but is nearly finished i have had a real job had to take up all the stair carpit carpet have had a woman to scrub and i hope to get it down this week georgeys George's house is kept in good condition it wouldent wouldn't be if i wasent wasn't here it would soon look like a tenant house i have kept the two last months rent but have paid every cent of it on the house) and he dident didn't give me a cent the two last times he was home he asked me if i wanted any of course i said no as he took out 30 dollars and said to his wife that had to last or asked her if it would last them a month she said they would get some from lowelLowell i said i had an order from waltWalt that would last me) but waltWalt for all that George would never sese me want i have too high an opinion of him to think he would ever shirk in any way if i was needy) but they want very much to get this house clear and i want him too to as its a nice place
write in your this weeks letter what day you will come walterWalter
